intro: Aphyllon dugesii, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink to purple, typically in late spring or early summer. The plant has a short, sturdy stem and narrow, grass-like leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its root system is deep and extensive, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. Aphyllon dugesii plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various desert animals.
